rename.from: [Bug]: type error while importing svelte 5 component due to recent change in svelte-check
rename.to: [Bug]: type error while importing `svelte 5` component due to recent change in `svelte-check`

body: Am experiencing this as well. My 40+ storybook files are failing type checking, though they continue to display fine in the UI.

issue.title: Svelte 5 migration

repository.name: annotorious
repository.description: Add image annotation functionality to any web page with a few lines of JavaScript.

issue.body:
Initial stab at migrating core components and types to svelte 5. Not remotely ready for merge, but at a point where I wouldn't want to put in any more without direction from @rsimon if you think it's worth pursuing.

Notes:

1. I'm not sure if this works or not.
2. I stayed mostly in the code checking types rather than addressing functionality. Most likely I turned something off in addition to the shortcomings loaded below.
3. I'm able to load `http://localhost:5173/test/index.html` without console errors and with the shapes showing up and `npm test` succeeds.
4. I don't think I've tested the editor components.
5. Remaining errors on running `npx svelte-check` are primarily around the OSD package, which I didn't attempt to fully migrate, and some type errors on passing the editor/ that I think may be harmless based on [this thread](https://github.com/storybookjs/storybook/issues/29308).
6. The diff is larger than it needs to be because prettier did some changes when I saved, sorry. If desired I could put a separate PR first that adds a [`pretty-quick`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/pretty-quick) hook closer to the project style.
7. I commented out the bits relating to registering new plugins because it was hard and I don't completely understand the use case. I have some fuzzy ideas about how to expose interfaces there but wasn't sure if it was in-bounds to tweak the external plugin API at all.
8. Left a number of TODOs scattered throughout.

body: I'm experiencing the exact same problem with 43 stories files.
I have the same error. New type of svelte component `Component` should be added but `ComponentType` used in storybook ðŸ˜”

Typings mentioned by @bhvngt, do not really solve the problem. If you use them, you will loose type checking of stories `args`. Pretty big loss. 

This is a blocker for us in the Svelte 5 migration. I expect that if we wait a year or two, then it will be solved.
